title: Bella Hadid Responds to Adidas Campaign Controversy
message:
Bella Hadid offered a response on Monday to the controversy surrounding her involvement in a recent Adidas campaign featuring shoes inspired by the 1972 Munich Games.
“For Adidas to pick a vocal anti-Israel model to recall this dark Olympics is either a massive oversight or intentionally inflammatory.
“I will forever stand by my people of Palestine while continuing to advocate for a world free of antisemitism.
Antisemitism has no place in the liberation of the Palestinian people.
“We are conscious that connections have been made to tragic historical events — though these are completely unintentional — and we apologize for any upset or distress caused.
event_breakdown: Antisemitism is on the rise in the United States, according to a new report by the Anti-Defamation League. The organization found that antisemitism is more widespread than previously thought, and that Jews are being targeted in a growing number of ways.

title: UCLA ordered by judge to craft plan in support of Jewish students
message:
FILE - Students gather on the UCLA campus to protest the Israel-Hamas War, April 29, 2024, in Los Angeles.
A federal judge ordered Monday, July 29, that UCLA craft a plan to protect Jewish students, months after pro-Palestinian protests broke out on campus.
(AP Photo/Damian Dovarganes,File)LOS ANGELES (AP) — A federal judge ordered Monday that the University of California, Los Angeles, craft a plan to protect Jewish students, months after pro-Palestinian protests broke out on campus.
Three Jewish students sued the university in June, alleging that they experienced discrimination on campus amid demonstrations against the Israel-Hamas war.
But Frankel argued UCLA was failing to foster a safe environment for Jewish students on campus.

title: UCLA ordered by judge to craft plan in support of Jewish students
message:
LOS ANGELES (AP) — A federal judge ordered Monday that the University of California, Los Angeles, craft a plan to protect Jewish students, months after pro-Palestinian protests broke out on campus.
Three Jewish students sued the university in June, alleging that they experienced discrimination on campus amid demonstrations against the Israel-Hamas war.
But Frankel argued UCLA was failing to foster a safe environment for Jewish students on campus.
The University was ordered to craft a proposed plan by next month.
At UCLA, law enforcement ordered in May that over a thousand protesters break up their encampment as tensions rose on campus.
location: LOS ANGELES is the city where the main event takes place.
event_breakdown: Target event is UCLA issuing a plan to protect Jewish students after pro-Palestinian protests.

title: UCLA ordered by judge to craft plan in support of Jewish students – Winnipeg Free Press
message:
LOS ANGELES (AP) — A federal judge ordered Monday that the University of California, Los Angeles, craft a plan to protect Jewish students, months after pro-Palestinian protests broke out on campus.
Three Jewish students sued the university in June, alleging that they experienced discrimination on campus amid demonstrations against the Israel-Hamas war.
The University was ordered to craft a proposed plan by next month.
At UCLA, law enforcement ordered in May that over a thousand protesters break up their encampment as tensions rose on campus.
In June, dozens of protesters on campus were arrested after they tried to set up a new encampment.

title: Trump rising Jewish support : Harley Lippman weighs in
message:
Lippman reflected on the shifting dynamics among American Jewish voters.
“Trump’s support among Jews has grown a lot, to the point that his numbers could very well surpass those of Reagan,” Lippman noted.
In 2022, President Biden appointed him to the USAID Partnership for Peace Fund to foster connections between Israelis and Palestinians.
He will be remembered for consistently standing alongside Israel,” Lippman analyzed.
He argued that this shift could reassure Jewish voters concerned about the progressive agenda.
location: Lippman noted that Trump's support among American Jewish voters had grown since 2022 to appoint
event_breakdown:
Event 1: Vandalism at a California synagogue
Event 2: Antisemitic graffiti at a Texas high school

title: Bella Hadid speaks out amid controversy over adidas campaign :  Shocked and upset
message:
“I am shocked, I am upset, and I am disappointed in the lack of sensitivity that went into this campaign.
Had I been made aware, from the bottom of my heart, I would never have participated.
“My team should have known, adidas should have known and I should have done more research so that I too would have known and understood, and spoken up.
“I will forever stand by my people of Palestine while continuing to advocate for a world free of antisemitism.
Adidas has apologised “for any upset or distress caused” by the connections being made between its campaign and “tragic historical events”.
event_breakdown: A synagogue in Miami, Florida, USA was defaced with antisemitic graffiti. The vandals drew a swastika and wrote “Hamas” and “Free Palestine” on the building.

title: Bella Hadid Releases Statement About adidas Campaign
message:
On July 18, Adidas received backlash from the American Jewish Committee (AJC) regarding its recent SL72 campaign, which stars Palestinian model Bella Hadid.
In response to the backlash, Adidas issued a statement that confirmed that it would be "revising" its campaign with Hadid, who has been vocal about her support for Palestine.
Hadid has since spoken out about her experience with the campaign, sharing a statement via Instagram stories.
"For those of you that do not know my heart, I want to make sure you're hearing directly from me about my recent campaign with adidas," the statement began.
My team should have known, adidas should have known and I should have done more research so that I too would have known and understood, and spoken up.
event_breakdown: Bella Hadid, Palestinian model, stars in an Adidas campaign, angering the American Jewish Committee. Adidas issues statement confirming revision of its campaign with Hadid, and Hadid shares her experience on Instagram.

title: Federal Judge Orders UCLA to Develop Plan to Protect Jewish Students
message:
A federal judge has ordered the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) to create a plan to safeguard Jewish students on campus, following pro-Palestinian protests in which Jews were attacked, threatened, and blatantly discriminated against.
Three Jewish students filed a lawsuit in June, claiming they faced a hostile environment amid demonstrations against the Israel-Hamas war.
One plaintiff, Yitzchok Frankel, a UCLA law student, stated that he declined an invitation to host a student event due to safety concerns.
“Under ordinary circumstances, I would have leapt at the chance to participate in this event,” Frankel said.
(YWN World Headquarters – NYC)
location: Based on the text you provided, the most specific location is UCLA, which is a public university in Los Angeles, California
event_breakdown: Three Jewish students, from the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA), filed a lawsuit in June following pro-Palestinian protests in which Jews were attacked, threatened, and blatantly discriminated against.The four students claim that they have been subjected to anti-Semitism and threats. They allege that UCLA created a hostile campus climate, and treated Jewish students unequally.

title: The Latest : Trump claims Harris , married to a Jewish man , doesnt like Jewish people
message: Former President Donald Trump has said in a radio interview that Vice President Kamala Harris “doesn’t like Jewish people” and appeared to agree with a host who called her Jewish husband, Doug Emhoff, “a crappy Jew.”

title: Pro - Israel Influencer Discusses Jewish Identity After Oct . 7 , How to Think About US Election as a Progressive Zionist
message:
We were all dressed up so nice and really trying to put our best foot forward,” Savetsky told The Algemeiner in a series of interviews this month.
I had never been more in love with Israel and in love with being a Jewish person.
“And then of course, Oct. 7 happened,” Savetsky told The Algemeiner.
Her Jewishness and support for Israel were present on her social media pages, but not, she noted, pronounced.
Anti-Zionists seized the opportunity to flood social media with a barrage of posts which, in addition to promoting ancient antisemitic tropes, vowed to lead a movement for Israel’s destruction.
location: Based on the information provided, the most specific location of the main event is Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.
event_breakdown:
On October 7th, 2021, an unidentified man spray-painted a swastika on the floor of a St. Louis Jewish cemetery and left antisemitic graffiti. The vandalism was the latest in a string of antisemitic incidents that have occurred in the cemetery city of Ladue in recent weeks.
The suspect fled before police arrived and no arrests have been made. The St. Louis Anti-Defamation League has condemned the vandalism and is offering a cash reward for any information leading to the arrest of the suspect.
The graffiti included messages such as "Two-state Solution Now!" and "Free Palestine."
